acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: There is no quantitive experimental data and it cannot be classified. In addition, there is a report that this substance contact to the rabbit skin for 6 hours and toxic effects was not seen (CICADS 42 (2002)). But ACGIH attaches Notation of Skin.  so the bad influence by skin exposure in long-term/repetition is considered.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: There is rat inhalation data that is converted to 8273ppm for 4 hours. Other two data are close to 13500ppm, which is a little more than 2.5 times the maximum of Category 4: 5000ppm (CICADS 42 (2002), IARC 52 (1991)), it was classified as Category 5.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 4 based on SPECIES: Rat;  ENDPOINT: LD50;:1350mg/kg;  REFERENCE SOURCE:  CICADS 42 (2002)

carcinogenicity.rationale: A carcinogenic examination using rats and mice was performed by NTP (TR-363 (1989)), ACGIH is estimating it as A3 based on this result. EU has classified into Car.Cat.3. It was set as "2" from these. Since IARC does not have several studies reports, it is concluded that it classified into 3.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: There is no examination data of metal corrosiveness and it cannot be classified. There is information that it reacts as promptly as with aluminum powders (IARC 52 (1991)), and there is fear of metal corrosion.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 2 because of its flash point: <23degC and initial Boiling point: >35degC

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The only in vivo test results which have been found were from experiments with drosophila (CICADS 42 (2002)). In in vitro tests, there is one strong positive result from the Ames test (0.185 revertants/nmol (review of original text by Dr. Sofuni)) but the chromosome aberration test is negative (IARC 52 (1991)). So it cannot be considered that there are several positive results. It was decided that the substance could not be classified according to the experts comments.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: There is data which says the ignition points is 511degC and it is thought that it does not ignite in room temperatures.

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale:
Since, testicular atrophy in the male rat is reported (NTP-TR-363 (1989)) and this is considered to be the influence on the reproduction potential of male (CICADS 42 (2002)), it was classified into "Category 2". 
There is an epidemiologic report of adverse effect to the female workers in pregnancy (ACGIH (2001)). 
However, since it was a mixed exposure with other solvents, it removed from the evidence of evaluation

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: It cannot be classified because examination data and epidemiology information cannot be obtained.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although the quantitive experiment report was not obtained, it was set as "Category 2A-2B" by the statement of eye irritant about humans (ICSC (2001), CICADS 42 (2002), ACGIH (2001), Patty (5th.2001)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is a test result of irritant and non-irritant on rabbits (CICADS 42 (2002)). And it was classified as Category 3 based on the statement of "skin irritant" on humans (Patty (5th.2001)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: It cannot be classified because examination data and epidemiology information cannot be obtained.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since HSDB (2005) has the description which suggests a chronic effects on the central nervous systems in humans, and an ACGIH-TVL advice value has the statement of "CNS impair", it was classified to as Category 2 (central nervous systems). Although "hepatic dysfunction" was mentioned in the TLV advice value, it was withheld to use for classification since the  inhalation exposure test for rats, which is used as an evidence, was carried out overdose the guidance value of 2, 583 ppm * 4 hours /a day.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (nervous system, respiratory system),
Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (nervous system, respiratory system)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale:
The influence from anesthetic on the peripheral and central nerves is reported in a human case (ACGIH (2001)). Moreover, since the respiratory-organs stimulus and the lung stimulus were also described (Patty (5th.2001)). So it was set as "Category 1 (nerve system, the respiratory system) and Category 3 (anesthetic)".
Anesthesia is identified in the animal inhalation experiments, too.
